subject: How (or whether) to test this
msgSnippet: I m a relative neophyte to unit testing.  I don t have much trouble in writing tests for new code for existing apps, but can t seem to get my head around
messageBody:
I'm a relative neophyte to unit testing. I don't have much trouble in
writing tests for new code for existing apps, but can't seem to get my
head around test-first from the ground up on a new app.

As an example, I recently wrote a small utility that views the header
info of an mp3, and renames the file from the information contained
therein. You pass it (on the command line) the name of a directory or
file, and a 'template' which includes the format of the name it should
generate. If a file is passed, it renames the file. If a directory is
passed, it recursively renames all files in the directory. An example
name template would be something like "%b - %n" for "Artist - Track
Title".

I actually got halfway finished with it, then deleted all of my code,
since I hadn't done it test-first, but then couldn't think how to go
about testing it. I'm using an external lib (jd3lib) for reading mp3
header info, and the standard java.io stuff for file manipulation.
Every test I can think of would just test external code (reading mpeg
header info, file renaming, etc), so I'm somewhat at a loss. Is there
anyone out there who'd like to get me started with a couple tests?

Thanx much,
BRiaN
